data.title: List of Norwegian Americans – WikiStrinda
data.text:
Wikipedia, engelsk utgave har en liste over norskættede amerikanere fordelt på ulike yrker.

Listen teller over 600 personer. Angivelse av "Homestead" i Norge for emigrantene kan variere i detaljering, men burde bli gjenstand for detaljstudier for å finne slektskap mellom Norge og Amerika. Aktive lenker i Wikipedia (som også utvides i antall), se nederst på siden. Noen personer (15) er beskrevet med egne biografier her i WikiStrinda. Der det foreligger norske versjoner av biografiene er disse forsøkt flettet inn i oversikten.

Akademikere

Burton Hatlen – (April 9, 1936 – January 21, 2008 i Santa Barbara, California) American literary scholar and professor at the University of Maine. His father Julius immigrated in 1909 from Norway. He married Lily Torvend, a second generation Norwegian-American; they sometimes spoke Norwegian at home.

Carl Richard Hagen (born 2 February 1937 i Chicago)– professor of particle physics at the University of Rochester.

Hans-Jørgen Holman – (20 February 1925 – 6 August 1986 i Drammen). Norwegian-American musicologist and educationalist. He was the only child of Hans and Kirsten Halvorsen Guttormsen.

Robert (Bob) Arthur Haugen – (June 26, 1942 i Chicago – January 6, 2013) financial economist and pioneer in the field of quantitative investing.

Lloyd Hustvedt – (April 18, 1922 i Sogn Valley in Goodhue County, Minnesota. – February 2, 2004)-Norwegian-born American professor and scholar of history.In 1954, Lloyd Hustvedt was married to Norwegian native Ester Vegan with whom he had four children including the author Siri Hustvedt.https://no.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siri_Hustvedt

Jakob Larsen – (March 1, 1888 i Decorah, Iowa– September 2, 1974). American classical scholar. He was the son of Peter Laurentius Larsen, founding president of Luther College, and his second wife Ingeborg Astrup (1846–1923).He was married to Clarice (Grindeland) Larsen (1886–1974). He died during 1974 in Columbia, Missouri. Both he and his wife were buried in the Lutheran Cemetery Winneshiek County, Iowa.

David Thoresen Lykken – (June 18, 1928 in Minneapolis – September 15, 2006) behavioral geneticist and Professor Emeritus of Psychology and Psychiatry at the University of Minnesota)

Paul Henry Nystrom – (January 25, 1878 i Maiden Rock, Wisconsin – August 17, 1969) professor of marketing at Columbia University.

Carleton Myron Opgaard – (February 18, 1929 in Fort Ransom, North Dakota– July 6, 2014 in Tacoma, WA) American college and university administrator and founding president of Vancouver Island University

Reidar Fauske Sognnaes – (November 6, 1911i Bergen – September 21, 1984). Sognnæs grew up in Bergen and took his final exams at Tanks gymnas in 1931. Dean of the Harvard School of Dental Medicine, founding Dean of the UCLA School of Dentistry and world-renowned scholar in the field of oral pathology

Historikere og sosiologer

Kenneth O.Bjork – (19.7.1909 i Enderlin, North Dakota, USA - 1.8.1991 i Northfield, Minnesota) American professor, historian and author.

Carl Blegen – (January 27, 1887 i Minneapolis– August 24, 1971) American archaeologist famous for his work on the site of Pylos in modern-day Greece and Troy in modern-day Turkey. Blegen var sønn av Anna Regine (født Olsen) og John H. Blegen som begge utvandret fra Norge og bror av historikeren Theodore C. Blegen. https://no.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Blegen

Theodore C. Blegen – (16.7.1891 i Minneapolis - 18.7.1969 i Minneapolis)- American historian and author.Foreldre var Anna Regine (1854-1925) og John H. Blegen (1851-1928), begge hadde emigrert fra Lillehammer. Hans far var professor ved Augsburg College i Minneapolis.

Elise Marie Boulding (født 6. juli 1920 i Bærum, død 24. juni 2010 i Needham) – Hun var datter av ingeniør Josef Biørn-Hansen (1892–1964) og Birgit Marianna f. Johnsen (1893–1945). Familien bodde på Malurtåsen i Bærum da hun ble født, før familien emigrerte til USA i 1923. Familien bodde i Syracuse, New York. Quaker sociologist Norwegian, and author credited as a major contributor to creating the academic discipline of Peace and Conflict Studies.

Odd S. Lovoll (født 6. oktober 1934 i Sande i Møre og Romsdal. )– American author, historian and educator.https://no.wikipedia.org/wiki/Odd_Lovoll.

Peter A. Munch – (December 19, 1908 i Nes, Hedmark– January 10, 1984) . Norwegian-American sociologist, educator and author.He was the second cousin of the painter Edvard Munch (1868-1944) and the first cousin thrice removed of his own namesake, the historian Peter Andreas Munch (1810-1863). His great-grandfather was the poet and bishop Johan Storm Munch 1778-1832), whose son, Munch's grandfather, Johan Storm Munch (evangelist) (1827-1898) served as missionary to the United States and was the subject of Munch's book, The Strange American Way. Peter Munch's aunt was the feminist and early female surgeon Kristine Munch and his great-uncle the poet Andreas Munch.On his mother's side, Munch was the grandson of architect/engineer Georg Bull (1829-1927) and nephew of architect Henrik Bull (1864-1953). His great-uncles were the violinist Ole Bull (1810-1880), who entertained in America, and Knud Bull (1811-1889), who was an emigree to Australia. His first cousin once removed was the architect Schak Bull (1858-1956).In 1934, Peter Munch married Helene Stephansen, with whom he had three children. Dr. Munch died in Pleasant Hill, Tennessee at 75 years of age in 1984.

Carlton Chester Qualey – (December 17, 1904 i Spring Grove, Minnesota – March 25, 1988)American professor, author and historian.Son of Ole O. Qualey (1858–1937) and Clara Amalia (Knatterud) Qualey (1868–1947).

Rick Steves (born May 10 1955 in Barstow, California )– American author, historian. His mother, June Erna, was born to Norwegian immigrants Harold and Erna Fremmerlid.

Martin Ulvestad – (født 24. desember 1865 på Ulvestad i Volda, død 19. januar 1942 i Seattle) - American historian and author whose writings focused on Norwegian-American immigration. https://no.wikipedia .org/wiki/Martin_Ulvestad

Thorstein Bunde Veblen – (July 30, 1857 in Cato Wisconsin– August 3, 1929)-American economist and sociologist. Parents from Norway;Thomas Veblen and Kari Bunde. He was the sixth of twelve children.His parents had emigrated from Norway to Milwaukee, Wisconsin, on September 16, 1847

Gene Myron Amdahl (November 16, 1922 – November 10, 2015)– Norwegian-born computer architect and hi-tech entrepreneur.Amdahl was born to immigrant parents of Norwegian and Swedish descent in Flandreau, South Dakota.https://no.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gene_Amdahl

George Awsumb (20 July 1880 – 24 November 1959)– Norwegian-born, prominent American architect of 20th century.

George Edwin Bergstrom (March 12, 1876 – June 17, 1955) – American architect most noted for his design work on the Pentagon in Arlington County, Virginia. Faren George O. Bergstrom, opprinnelig Jørgen Olaf Bergstrøm, ble født i Asker og kom til Amerika som barn, sammen med sine foreldre, Johannes og Jørgine.

Frederick William Cappelen – (October 21, 1857 – October 16, 1921) Norwegian-born architect and civil engineer who held the office of Minneapolis City Engineer

Leighton Dahl – (May 11, 1894 – July 18, 1987) prominent American architect of 20th century.George Dahl was born in Minneapolis to Norwegian immigrant parents, Olaf G. and Laura (Olson) Dahl.

Joachim Goschen Giæver – (15 August 1856 – 29 May 1925) .Civil engineer involved in the construction of the framework to Statue of Liberty.He was the youngest of eight children born to Jens Holmboe Giæver (1813–1884) and Hanna Birgithe Holmboe (1821–1903).

Jon Adams Jerde January 22, 1940 – February 9, 2015)– American architect.

Peter Johnsen ()

Henry William Orth – (April 14, 1866 - March 5, 1946) American architect. Harold William Orth was born on a ship en route to the United States from Christiana (Oslo), Norway, on April 14, 1866. His exact date of arrival to the United States is unknown. He was educated at a business college (location unknown). He married Esther Susan Trigalet and settled in St. Paul, Minnesota.

John Aasen – (March 5, 1890 in Minneapolis– August 1, 1938) American silent film actor, one of the tallest actors in history.His mother, Kristi (Danielsen) from Rollag in Numedal.https://no.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Aasen

Jean Arthur – (born Gladys Georgianna Greene; October 17, 1900 in Pittsburgh, New York – June 19, 1991) American actress and a major film star of the 1930s and 1940s . Parents, Johanna Augusta Nelson and Hubert Sidney Greene.[7] Gladys' Lutheran maternal grandparents immigrated from Norway to the American West after the Civil War.https://no.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jean_Arthur.

Nina Arvesen (born May 16, 1961 in White Plains, New York )– American actress of Norwegian extraction, best known for her performances on American soap operas.Her father, Jan Arvesen, was a Norwegian diplomat and was Norway's ambassador to Mexico (1979-1985), to Costa Rica (1985-1991) and to Portugal (1996-1998). Her mother, Sidsel was an actress in Norway.

Richard Dean Anderson – (born January 23, 1950 in Minneapolis) American television and film actor, producer and composer.He is the eldest of four sons born to Stuart Jay Anderson, a teacher, and Jocelyn Rhae Carter, an artist. https://no.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Dean_Anderson

James Arness – May 26, 1923 – June 3, 2011) American actor, best known for portraying Marshal Matt Dillon in the television series Gunsmoke, of part Norwegian descent and was brother of actor Peter Graves.His parents were businessman Rolf Cirkler Aurness and journalist Ruth Duesler. His father's ancestry was Norwegian;The family name had been Aursnes, but when Rolf's father, Peter Aursnes, emigrated from Norway in 1887, he changed it to Aurness.https://no.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Arness

Dorothy Arnold – (born Dorothy Arnoldine Olson; November 21, 1917 in Duluth, Minnesota– November 13, 1984) American film actress.

Carole Landis/Frances Lillian Mary Ridste – (born January 1, 1919 in Fairchild, Wisconsin, – July 5, 1948) was an American actress and singer. American film and stage actress. Father, Norwegian-American Alfred Ridste, a drifting railroad mechanic who abandoned the family after Landis's birth.

Kristanna Loken – (born October 8, 1979 in Ghent, New York)-American actress known for her work in both film and television, and as a fashion model, is of half Norwegian and half German descent.Loken is of Norwegian descent from her great-grandparents, and her grandparents also spoke Norwegian.

John Lund – (February 6, 1911 – May 10, 1992) American film actor who is probably best remembered for his role in the film A Foreign Affair.John Lund's father was a Norwegian immigrant and glassblower in Rochester, New York.

Jena Malone – (born November 21, 1984 in in Sparks, Nevada)-actress, of part Norwegian descent.The daughter of Deborah Malone and Edward Berge. Her father is of partly Norwegian descent; she also has Irish ancestry.https://no.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jena_Malone

[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christopher_Mitchum Christopher Mitchum] (born October 16, 1943 in He was born in Los Angeles, California) – American actor. He is the second son of film star Robert Mitchum and younger brother of actor James Mitchum, father was of half Norwegian descent

Piper Lisa Perabo ( born October 31, 1976) – American stage, film and television actress, mother Mary Charlotte (née Ulland),is of Norwegian descent.https://no.wikipedia.org/wiki/Piper_Perabo

Priscilla Ann Presley (née Wagner, formerly Beaulieu; born May 24, 1945)- American actress and businesswoman and ex-wife of musician Elvis Presley, of part Norwegian descent. Priscillas norske morfar, Albert Henry Iversen, emigrerte fra Egersund til USA på begynnelsen av 1900-tallet. Han giftet seg med Lorraine, som var av skotsk-irsk og engelsk avstamning. De fikk tre barn: Albert junior (mars 1922), James (mars 1924) og Anna Lillian Iversen (mars 1926).Sistnevnte ble senere kalt – eller navnet hennes ble endret til – Ann. Som barn ble hun kalt for «Rooney» (kort for Annie Rooney).I en alder av nitten år ble hun mor til Priscilla.https://no.wikipedia.org/wiki/Priscilla_Presley

His father Norwegian father was a Lutheran minister and changed the family's original surname, "Kvalen", to "Qualen" – though some sources give Oleson,later Oleson Kvalen as Qualen's earlier surnames.

Julia Rose – American actress (Star Trek: Enterprise, Code Monkeys, and CSI: NY)

Solberg, was a Lutheran minister, professor of History and Political Science, and director of Higher Education for the Lutheran Church in America (now part of the ELCA).

Hun møtte sveitsiske Emil Zellweger på Hurtigruten, og de giftet seg i 1963.De fikk etterhvert sønnen Drew i 1967, og Renée i 1969 da de bodde i Baytown i Texas.https://no.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ren%C3%A9e_Zellweger

Sønn av Richard Burton Matheson.Matheson was born in Allendale, New Jersey, to Norwegian immigrants Bertolf and Fanny Matheson.
